phase_1.objective: Free crew identity infrastructure with paid presentation upgrades and recruiter access monetisation.

cv_import.description: Upload CV to auto-populate profile fields
user_flow: User reviews and corrects extracted data
User confirms and saves to profile
cv_import.fallback: If parsing fails, skip silently to manual entry

manual_entry.description: Always available as alternative to CV import
manual_entry.note: CV import is convenience, not requirement

presentation_layer.constraints: Cosmetic only. Never alters trust outcomes.

crew_pro.description: Enhanced features for active crew, especially those who hire

search.pro: Unlimited database search with full profile access

profile_analytics.pro: Full: who viewed, when, which yacht

recruiter_visibility.pro: See which recruiters unlocked your profile

entity_model.note: Users attach to yacht entities, not name strings

behaviour: Users may select an existing yacht or create a new one
Yachts display number of attached crew
Renamed yachts are separate entities (no merging in Phase 1)
Duplicate names are tolerated (multiple 'Lady M' entries acceptable)
No reviews, ratings, comments, or interaction on yacht entities
yacht_graph.future_use: Permanent infrastructure for Phase 2 yacht dashboards and Phase 3 diagnostics

gating.note: Connections alone do not permit endorsements

components: Structured metadata (role, yacht, dates worked together)
structure.limit: One endorsement per engagement per yacht

editing.backend_tracking: Retractions tracked internally, affect endorser weighting

availability_broadcast.scope: Private broadcast to connections only (free) or 2nd degree (Pro)

availability_toggle.description: Crew opt into being discoverable via search
availability_toggle.recruiter_visibility: Can hide from recruiters while visible to other crew

deletion.effect_on_endorsements: Endorsements from that engagement remain unless separately deleted

verification.mitigation: False claims don't accumulate reinforcing signals

peer_hiring.description: Crew find crew — job postings with graph-aware applications

poster_requirements.note: No employer-only accounts. Captains and HODs are crew.

limits.bundle_request: Manual request for >3 (e.g., new yacht build)

application_flow.apply_with: Profile link (full profile visible to poster)

graph_visibility.to_poster: Mutual connections, shared yachts, endorsement paths
graph_visibility.to_applicant: Poster's full profile, endorsements, employment history

application_flow.messaging: Direct message between poster and applicant

peer_hiring.rationale: Both parties are nodes in the trust graph. Hiring is a use case for the graph, not a separate product.

recruiter_access.description: Paid read-only access for recruitment agencies to search crew pool

subscription.required: Must have active subscription to use credits

credits.purpose: Unlock profile name and contact details from search results

can_do: Filter by role, certs, experience, availability
Sort by endorsement count, experience, recency
View full profiles via direct link
cannot_do: See crew who opted out of recruiter visibility

profile_visibility.after_unlock: Full profile access, permanent for that recruiter-crew pair

anti_gaming: Recruiter accounts cannot be crew accounts
crew_protection: Toggle visibility to recruiters independently of crew visibility
recruiter_access.rationale: Monetises recruiter access without corrupting trust. Recruiters pay for efficient discovery, not influence. Crew control their visibility.

profile_visibility_rules.description: Contextual access based on how profile is accessed

direct_link_or_qr.sees: Full profile including contact details (per crew settings)

profile_visibility_rules.rationale: Direct sharing preserves linktr.ee use case. Search is monetised because it's the efficient discovery path.
